DataElement.preferredDefinition: The code that describes the reason an adverse event is defined as serious.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Domain Serious Adverse Event Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to an adverse event._Any expected or unexpected adverse event, related or unrelated to the intervention, occurring at any agent dose, any phase of product or procedure testing, that results in any of the following outcomes: death, a life-threatening adverse event, requires inpatient hospitalization (not required as part of the treatment) or prolongation of existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant disability or incapacity, or cancer, or a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Important medical events that may not result in the listed outcomes may be considered as serious when, based upon appropriate medical judgment, they represent significant hazards or potentially serious harm to the research subject or others and may require medical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes listed in this definition._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to an adverse event.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any expected or unexpected adverse event, related or unrelated to the intervention, occurring at any agent dose, any phase of product or procedure testing, that results in any of the following outcomes: death, a life-threatening adverse event, requires inpatient hospitalization (not required as part of the treatment) or prolongation of existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant disability or incapacity, or cancer, or a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Important medical events that may not result in the listed outcomes may be considered as serious when, based upon appropriate medical judgment, they represent significant hazards or potentially serious harm to the research subject or others and may require medical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes listed in this definition.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: Any expected or unexpected adverse event, related or unrelated to the intervention, occurring at any agent dose, any phase of product or procedure testing, that results in any of the following outcomes: death, a life-threatening adverse event, requires inpatient hospitalization (not required as part of the treatment) or prolongation of existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant disability or incapacity, or cancer, or a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Important medical events that may not result in the listed outcomes may be considered as serious when, based upon appropriate medical judgment, they represent significant hazards or potentially serious harm to the research subject or others and may require medical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes listed in this definition.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDSIC aligned NCI Standard CRFs. ghd

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Text that describe why an adverse event is defined as serious.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The termination of life associated with an adverse event.

Concepts.definition: The termination of life associated with an adverse event.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any adverse event that places the patient, in the view of the initial reporter, at immediate risk of death from the adverse event as it occurred, i.e., it does not include an adverse experience that, had it occurred in a more severe form, might have caused death.

Concepts.longName: Life Threatening or Disabling Adverse Event
Concepts.definition: Any adverse event that places the patient, in the view of the initial reporter, at immediate risk of death from the adverse event as it occurred, i.e., it does not include an adverse experience that, had it occurred in a more severe form, might have caused death.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Requires inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Requires inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Inpatient Hospitalization or Prolongation of Existing Hospitalization Required

Concepts.longName: Hospitalization or Prolongation of Existing Hospitalization Required
Concepts.definition: An indication or description that an extended period of hospitalization is necessary.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication or description of a continuing and significant impairment.

Concepts.longName: Persistent or Significant Disability or Incapacity
Concepts.definition: An indication or description of a continuing and significant impairment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any abnormality, anatomical or biochemical, evident at birth or during the neonatal period.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormality, anatomical or biochemical, evident at birth or during the neonatal period.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: In the medical judgment of the treating physician and/or investigator, it may jeopardize the participant or require intervention to prevent one of these outcomes

ValueMeaning.preferredName: In the medical judgment of the treating physician and/or investigator, it may jeopardize the participant or require intervention to prevent one of these outcomes
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: In the medical judgment of the treating physician and/or investigator, it may jeopardize the participant or require intervention to prevent one of these outcomes
Be specific about something; define clearly.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Associated concept to VM for TCGA. mc 11/9/12 - reversed concept order to match the semantics of this phrase which is "other" with "specify" as a qualifier/modifier - DW 12-30-2015

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Meets criteria per protocol but does not meet other criterion (above)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Meets criteria per protocol but does not meet other criterion (above)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Meets criteria per protocol but does not meet other criterion (above)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the outcome or resolution of the patient's adverse events.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.

ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 2179679 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.
